API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.x trunk

sandy.util.StringUtil

type
class
version
3.1
Utility class for string manipulation.

Static Methods

clear(p_sStr : String, p_aExpand : Array<String>) : String

parameters
p_sStr The string to modify.
p_aExpand Other strings you want to clear out.
returns
The modified string.
Strips "\r" and "\n" characters from a string and removes consecutive spaces.

clearRepeat(p_sStr : String, p_sRepeat : String, ?p_sReplace : String) : String

parameters
p_sRepeat The pattern to clear out.
p_sReplace Replace chars, default is a space.
returns
The modified string.
Clears the source string from multiple occurences of a pattern.

Ex: If you want to clear "ababab", you can use "ab" as a pattern.

findBlockIndex(p_sStr : String, p_sStart : String, p_sEnd : String) : Array<Array<Int>>

parameters
p_sStr The string to search.
p_sStart Block start with.
p_sEnd Block end with.
returns
An array containtng all the start and end indices.
Returns pairs of start and end indices of a block in a source string.

The target string is searched for blocks of text between a start and and an end delimiter string.
The start and end indices into the searched string, for each found block is stored in a two dimensional array.
All inices are returned as an array of index pairs.

array struct:

array0 = Block_Start_String_Length, Block_End_String_Length

array1 = Start_Index_1, End_Index_1

arrayx = Start_Index_x, End_Index_x

getBlockByIndex(p_sStr : String, p_aPairs : Array<Array<Int>>, p_nIndex : Float, p_bNoSymbol : Bool) : String

parameters
p_sStr The string to search.
p_aPairs Index pairs created by findBlockIndex.
p_nIndex Start index into the string of the block to search for.
p_bNoSymbol Do not include start and end symbols.
returns
The searched sub string or an empty string if not found.
Returns a specific sub string of the source string.

getBlockRange(p_aPairs : Array<Array<Int>>, p_nIndex : Float) : Array<Int>

parameters
p_aPairs Index pairs created by findBlockIndex.
p_nIndex Start index into the string of the block of interest.
returns
The pair of start and end indices, [-1, -1] if not found.
Returns the start and end indices for a substr, analyzed by findBlockIndex.

getBlocks(p_sStr : String, p_aPairs : Array<Array<Int>>, p_bWithSymbol : Bool) : Array<String>

parameters
p_sStr The string to search.
p_aPairs Index pairs created by findBlockIndex.
p_bWithSymbol Include start and end symbols if set to true.
returns
All blocks between the start and end indices.
Returns all blocks between start and end indices from a source string.

Given an array of index pairs, normally created by a call to findBlockIndex, all blocks between index pairs are extracted and stored in an array

getTextBetween(p_sStr : String, p_sStart : String, p_sEnd : String) : Array<String>

parameters
p_sStr The string to search.
p_sStart The start delimiter.
p_sEnd The end delimiter.
returns
An array of found sub strings. Empty if no matching patterns were found.
Returns all sub strings in a string between two given delimiter patterns.

The delimiters are not included in the results.

indexTimes(p_sStr : String, p_sSubstr : String, p_nOccur : Int, p_nStart : Int) : Int

parameters
p_sStr The string to search.
p_sSubstr Sub string you want find.
p_nOccur The occurance of the sub string to find.
p_nStart Start index for the search.
returns
Start index of the search sub string.
Returns the index of the Nth occurance of sub string.

replace(p_sStr : String, p_sOld : String, p_sNew : String) : String

parameters
p_sStr The string to modify.
p_sOld The pattern to replace.
p_sNew What to replace the pattern with.
returns
The modified string.
Replaces a sub string with another in the target string.
